data.title: African American Music
data.meta_description: Isaac Hayes - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Isaac Hayes was an influential American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. He was a creative force behind Stax Records in the 1960s, writing hit songs for artists like Sam & Dave and producing albums. Hayes began a successful solo career in the late 1960s with albums like Hot Buttered Soul and Black Moses that featured his deep voice and pioneering fusion of funk, soul and jazz. He is best known for composing the theme song for the 1971 film Shaft, for which he won an Academy Award. Hayes had a successful acting career in addition to his musical work.
